content.text:
# Houston Film Critics Society Awards 2024

| location  = [https://matchouston.org Midtown Arts & Theater Center Houston], Texas
| website   =
| previous  = 2023
| main      = HFCSA
| next      = 2025
}}
The 18th Houston Film Critics Society Awards were announced on January 14, 2025, at the Midtown Arts & Theater Center Houston (MATCH) in Texas. The nominations were announced on January 7, 2025, with The Brutalist leading the nominations with nine, followed by Conclave with eight, and Anora, Dune: Part Two and Wicked all receiving six each.
Comedy-drama film Anora led the awards with three wins: Best Picture, Best Actress (Mikey Madison), and Best Screenplay (Sean Baker).
The nominees for the Texas Independent Film Award were announced on December 15, 2024.
Winners and nominees
, Best Director winner]]
, Best Actor winner]]
, Best Actress winner]]
, Best Supporting Actor winner]]
, Best Supporting Actress winner]]
, Best Screenplay winner]]
and Atticus Ross, Best Original Score winners]]
Winners are listed first and highlighted with boldface.

* '[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt30291321/ Runaway Radio]: Mike McGuff revisits the magic created by Houston 101 KLOL'
** [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt26454725/ Deliveries from Eva]: Lakisha R. Lemons explores a complex relationship between a forgotten music star and a delivery driver
** [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt33132188/ The Ego Death of Queen Cecilia]: Chris Beier follows a former YouTube star trying to find her place in an unfriendly world
** Lost Soulz'': Katherine Propper tracks a rapper's journey into himself and his music
** [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt26935084/ When Houston Had the Blues]: Alan Swyer considers the impact of the city's Black music scene
